The one thing that has been rightly expl: A mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption
They enter and remain in the second absorption
They enter and remain in the third absorption
They enter and remain in the fourth absorption
A mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of love
A mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of compassion
A mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of rejoicing
A mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of equanimity

A mendicant, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space
A mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness
A mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness
The offerings made by the householder Da: Assembled the Saṅgha from Vesālī and Pāṭaliputta
Served and satisfied them with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods
Clothed each and every mendicant in a pair of garments
Provided a set of three robes for Ānanda
Had a dwelling worth five hundred built for Ānanda
